concept.title: Configuring the Delivery Guarantee
concept.shortdesc: The delivery guarantee determines when a pipeline commits the offset. When configuring the delivery guarantee for RPC pipelines, use the same option in both origin and destination pipelines.

conbody.p: RPC Pipelinesdelivery guaranteedelivery guaranteeconfiguration in RPC pipelinesA set of RPC pipelines process data like a single pipeline: The origin pipeline creates a batch, passes it through the pipeline, then passes it to the destination pipeline. Only when the destination pipeline writes the batch to its destination systems does the commit the offset. As with standard pipelines, you can use the delivery guarantee property to define how the commits the offset.

Use At Least Once in both pipelines to ensure the RPC pipelines process all data. Use At Most Once in both pipelines to avoid the possible duplication of data. If the RPC pipelines are configured to use different delivery guarantees, the uses At Least Once.
